raw: {{Infobox location poe2 | game = poe2 | map = PE2 Sacred Stair.png | caption_map = | name = The Sacred Stair | type = District | description = | exits = Serpent's Crown;Brass Citadel;Queen's Berth | sub_locations = The Hanging Sepulchers;Spire of the Soul-Seers;Temple of Berath (Neketaka){{!}}Temple of Berath;Temple of Gaun;Magran's Temple | merchant = Dawnstar Vendor;Temple Vendor;Tiabo | innkeeper = | inhabitants = High Priest Hati;Mark van der Bij;Okauro | main_location = Neketaka | plants = Ink Harp;Pox Cap;Ratiti Root;Razorgill;River Reed | expected_level= 6 | grants_xp = yes | override_xp = | is_crit_path = no | can_camp = no | zone_id = zn_07_temple_district | internalname = AR_0701_Temple_District_Ext | guid = 7cb374b5-42a9-4e2d-9851-5a67dbb0c408 | lsc = | icon = Neketaka Map Area Temple District.png }} '''{{PAGENAME}}''' is a [[Pillars of Eternity II: Deadfire world map|location]] in {{poe2}}. ==Background== The Sacred Stair is one of the oldest occupied parts of Neketaka, serving as its de facto temple district. A variety of gods are worshipped across the district, the most notable being, of course, the Huana versions of the Eoran pantheon. ==Points of interest== * This is a large, open area with several temples (as can be expected). The [[Spire of the Soul-Seers]] is in the northwest, looming over the district, with a merchant stall nearby. * The centerpiece of the area is a large, open-air temple dedicated to [[Magran]], with High Priest Hati and Mark van der Bij there. * Other temples are the Temple of Gaun to the northeast, occupied by the [[Children of the Dawnstars]], the [[Temple of Berath]], and [[The Hanging Sepulchers]]. * To the southwest, on a walkway beneath the Temple of Berath are two separate methods of entrance to The Hanging Sepulchers. ** A stone door requiring "a religious artifact, blessed by Berath" to open. With Religion 3, you can decipher the etchings on the door. Opened during [[Eulogy for the Dead]]. ** Just by the stone door is a tree, which starts a scripted interaction. With a [[Rope and Grappling Hook (Deadfire)|Rope and Grappling Hook]], you can climb down to reach an opening to the tomb in the cliff side, requiring Athletics 3 to avoid detriment. Once in the tomb hallways, Perception 11 will allow you to spot a glittering [[Ruby (Deadfire)|Ruby]] in a cubbyhole in the wall. ==Characters== * [[Tiabo]], merchant selling animancer-related goods. * [[Temple Vendor]], merchant selling potions, traps, and miscellany. * [[Okauro]], offers a number of bounties. * [[Dawnstar Vendor]], vendor selling wares for the needy. * [[High Priest Hati]], Magranite priest - interacted with during [[Her Last Request]]. * [[Mark van der Bij]], offers training (+1 [[Alchemy]], +1 [[Religion]]) for {{cp2|3000}}. '''During [[Bounty - Katrenn]]:''' * [[Katrenn]], and her automatons. ==Loot== * [[The Magnificent Escape Cape]]: Sold by the Temple Vendor. * [[The Amazing and Truly Incredible Instant Potion Belt]]: Sold by Tiabo. ==Pets== * [[Okura's Kettle]]: Sold by Tiabo. * [[Animancy Cat]]: Sold by Tiabo. * [[Pozzi]] - "Forsaken Cat": At the top of the stairs in the temple of Magran. ==Plants== * [[Pox Cap]] * [[Razorgill]] * [[Ratiti Root]] * [[River Reed]] * [[Ink Harp]] ==Behind the scenes== * An additional unused location called [[Magran's Temple]] (and its sub-location [[The Champion's Hearth]]) exist in the game files. This indicates that The Temple of Magran was perhaps initially planned as an interior location, rather than being in the center of the district as it is now. It can only be accessed with [[Console#AreaTransition|AreaTransition]], or with F11 after entering IRoll20s. ** This area was subsequently removed in a later patch to the game. ==Gallery== PE2_Spire_of_the_Soul-Seers_Exterior.png | [[Spire of the Soul-Seers]] PE2_Temple_of_Berath_Exterior.png | [[Temple of Berath]] / [[The Hanging Sepulchers]] PE2_Temple_of_Magran_Exterior.png | Temple of Magran {{DEFAULTSORT:Sacred Stair, The}}
